segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 2. Sāraṇīyavagga
segments.en: 2. Warm-hearted

segments.pli: 13. Nissāraṇīyasutta
segments.en: 13. Elements of Escape

segments.pli: “Chayimā, bhikkhave, nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these six elements of escape.

segments.pli: Katamā cha?
segments.en: What six?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take a mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘mettā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
segments.en: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by love. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

segments.pli: atha ca pana me byāpādo cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: Yet somehow ill will still occupies my mind.’

segments.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! Don’t say that. Don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for misrepresentation of the Buddha is not good. And the Buddha would not say that.

segments.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ mettāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
segments.en: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by love has been developed and properly implemented,

segments.pli: atha ca panassa byāpādo cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: yet somehow ill will still occupies the mind.

segments.pli: Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, byāpādassa yadidaṃ mettācetovimuttī’ti. (1)
segments.en: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘karuṇā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
segments.en: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by compassion. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

segments.pli: atha ca pana me vihesā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: Yet somehow the thought of harming still occupies my mind.’

segments.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

segments.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ karuṇāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
atha ca panassa vihesā cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, vihesāya yadidaṃ karuṇācetovimuttī’ti. (2)
segments.en: For it is the heart’s release by compassion that is the escape from thoughts of harming.’

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘muditā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
segments.en: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by rejoicing. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

segments.pli: atha ca pana me arati cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: Yet somehow negativity still occupies my mind.’

segments.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

segments.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ muditāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
atha ca panassa arati cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, aratiyā yadidaṃ muditācetovimuttī’ti. (3)
segments.en: For it is the heart’s release by rejoicing that is the escape from negativity.’

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘upekkhā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
segments.en: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by equanimity. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

segments.pli: atha ca pana me rāgo cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: Yet somehow desire still occupies my mind.’

segments.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

segments.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
atha ca panassa rāgo cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, rāgassa yadidaṃ upekkhācetovimuttī’ti. (4)
segments.en: For it is the heart’s release by equanimity that is the escape from desire.’

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘animittā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
segments.en: ‘I’ve developed the signless release of the heart. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

segments.pli: atha ca pana me nimittānusāri viññāṇaṃ hotī’ti.
segments.en: Yet somehow my consciousness still follows after signs.’

segments.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

segments.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ animittāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
atha ca panassa nimittānusāri viññāṇaṃ bhavissati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, sabbanimittānaṃ yadidaṃ animittācetovimuttī’ti. (5)
segments.en: For it is the signless release of the heart that is the escape from all signs.’

segments.pli: Idha pana bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asmīti kho me vigataṃ, ayamahamasmīti ca na samanupassāmi;
segments.en: ‘I’m rid of the conceit “I am”. And I don’t regard anything as “I am this”.

segments.pli: atha ca pana me vicikicchākathaṃkathāsallaṃ cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: Yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies my mind.’

segments.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! Don’t say that. Don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for misrepresentation of the Buddha is not good. And the Buddha would not say that.

segments.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ asmīti vigate ayamahamasmīti ca na samanupassato;
segments.en: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the conceit “I am” has been done away with, and nothing is regarded as “I am this”,

segments.pli: atha ca panassa vicikicchākathaṃkathāsallaṃ cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies the mind.

segments.pli: Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, vicikicchākathaṃkathāsallassa yadidaṃ asmīti mānasamugghāto’ti. (6)
segments.en: For it is the uprooting of the conceit “I am” that is the escape from the dart of doubt and indecision.’

segments.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, cha nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo”ti.
segments.en: These are the six elements of escape.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these six elements of escape.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha’s teachings are effective, so we can’t claim to have practiced them fully if we’re still afflicted by the various forms of suffering.
